feed.title: Reply All
feed.author: Gimlet
feed.description: "'A podcast about the internet' that is actually an unfailingly original exploration of modern life and how to survive it. " - The Guardian. Hosted by PJ Vogt and Alex Goldman, from Gimlet.

items.title: #109 Is Facebook Spying on You?
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
This year we’ve gotten one question more than any other from listeners: is Facebook eavesdropping on my conversations and showing me ads based on the things that I say? This week, Alex investigates.


Further Reading

Our guide to keep Facebook from following you around the internet can be found at http://replyall.limo/donttrackme .
Facebook's official statement that it is not listening to users.
Facebook's Rob Goldman (no relation) denying the same thing.
items.content:

items.title: #108 The Skip Tracer, Part II
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: Continued: Sruthi Pinnamaneni follows the world's best bounty hunter on a peculiar case.
items.content: Continued: Sruthi Pinnamaneni follows the world's best bounty hunter on a peculiar case.

items.title: #106 Is That You, KD?
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
This week, we help Alex Blumberg understand why a Google engineer ended up complimenting the KKK, and then Yes Yes No turns bizarro.


Further Reading

James Damore's unedited memo
Links to all of the tweets or stories mentioned in Yes Yes No can be found at http://yesyesnos.tumblr.com
Article about Kevin Durant (includes screenshots of his tweets)

items.title: #105 At World's End
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: Phia helps a listener track down a mythical, vanished video game.
items.content: Phia helps a listener track down a mythical, vanished video game.

items.title: #104 The Case of the Phantom Caller
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: A woman in New Jersey is getting strange phone calls to her office from unknown numbers. Every time she picks up, she finds herself eavesdropping on the life of a different stranger. Unsure what else to do, she calls in Super Tech Support.
items.content: A woman in New Jersey is getting strange phone calls to her office from unknown numbers. Every time she picks up, she finds herself eavesdropping on the life of a different stranger. Unsure what else to do, she calls in Super Tech Support.

items.title: #56 Zardulu
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: The rats are not what they seem. Also a new Yes Yes No. (This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)
items.content: The rats are not what they seem. Also a new Yes Yes No. (This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)

items.title: #44 Shine On You Crazy Goldman
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: A website for people who are way too high. Plus, could LSD unlock our better selves? Does PJ even have a better self? We investigate. (This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)
items.content: A website for people who are way too high. Plus, could LSD unlock our better selves? Does PJ even have a better self? We investigate. (This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)

items.title: #50 The Cathedral
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
Amy and Ryan Green’s one-year-old son is diagnosed with cancer and begins an agonizing period of treatment. And then, one night in the hospital, Ryan has a strange epiphany: this whole terrible ordeal should be a video game. 

(This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)

items.title: #36 Today’s the Day
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: On this week’s episode of Reply All, PJ and Alex go outside. (This month we’re rebroadcasting the best Reply All episodes, as chosen by you, the listeners. We’ll be back with new episodes in September.)

items.title: #103 Long Distance, Part II
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
This week, Alex and Damiano take a trip. This is the conclusion of last week's episode, Long Distance.



Further Reading

Snigdha Poonam's story on tech support scams in the Hindustan Times

If you suspect you are a victim of a tech support scammer, you see a suspicious pop-up, or get an unsolicited tech support email, you can make a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission by following this link, or by contacting the company that the call center was impersonating directly.

Microsoft fraud report page
Apple fraud report page

Microsoft did a global survey of tech support scams in 2016, and the results are pretty interesting. You can find it here.

items.title: #102 Long Distance
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
This week, a telephone scammer makes a terrible mistake. He calls Alex Goldman.

 


Further Reading

If you suspect you are a victim of a tech support scammer, you see a suspicious pop-up, or get an unsolicited tech support email, you can make a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission by following this link, or by contacting the company that the call center was impersonating directly.

Microsoft fraud report page
Apple fraud report page

Microsoft did a global survey of tech support scams in 2016, and the results are pretty interesting. You can find it here.

Oh, and don't be like Alex. Never let some stranger remotely connect to your computer.
items.content:

items.title: #101 Minka
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
A man takes on an impossible job: fixing the place you go before you die.

Further Info
Bill Thomas's website
Bill Thomas on Twitter
Tammy Marshall at The New Jewish Home

items.title: Introducing Mogul
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
Today we bring you episode one of Gimlet’s new show, “Mogul: The Life and Death of Chris Lighty.” It’s the story of the birth of hip-hop and a hip-hop legend, but it’s also about the darker side of the industry. It’s the story of how a kid from the Bronx, managed to rise so high. And how, when he got there, everything went so wrong.

Hear the entire Mogul series here.
items.content:

items.title: #100 Friends and Blasphemers
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: An online diary used by American teenagers confronts a strange and terrifying enemy.
items.content: An online diary used by American teenagers confronts a strange and terrifying enemy.

items.title: #28 Shipped to Timbuktu
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
An email to the wrong address sends us hurtling into the world of professional cookie advisors. Plus, a new Yes, Yes, No. This is a rebroadcast of a story.
Our theme song and scoring is from Breakmaster Cylinder. Ad music is by Build Buildings.

Adam West’s Tweet

items.title: #99 Black Hole, New Jersey
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: A mysterious thief has been using the internet to steal a bizarre array of items - watches, scooter parts, clown costumes. This week, Alex heads straight towards his hideout.
items.content: A mysterious thief has been using the internet to steal a bizarre array of items - watches, scooter parts, clown costumes. This week, Alex heads straight towards his hideout.

items.title: #98 Fog of Covfefe
items.author: Gimlet
items.description: The last person on earth who has not heard about covfefe walks into a studio, and a strange journey begins.
items.content: The last person on earth who has not heard about covfefe walks into a studio, and a strange journey begins.

items.title: #16 Why Is Mason Reese Crying?
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
For Jonathan Goldstein, YouTube offers endless nostalgia, but he always finds himself returning to the same subject – a precocious child actor from the early 70’s named Mason Reese. And then a few months ago, new clips of Reese began popping up on YouTube. What’s more, they appeared to be uploaded by Reese himself. Jonathan sets out to discover why – and why now, after 40 years. This is a rebroadcast of a story that originally came out in March of 2015.

Jonathan Goldstein is the host of the Gimlet Podcast Heavyweight

Heavyweight wants to hear about the moments you can’t let go of; the important thing you left unsaid; the decision that left you troubled for a long time to come. Call and tell Jonathan your story in a short voicemail: (347) 651-0822

Our theme song and scoring is from Breakmaster Cylinder. Ad music is by Build Buildings.

Mason Reese's Web Series, Life Interrupted.

A 1996 New York Times profile of Mason Reese.

The Kickstarter for Mason Reese’s new comedy series, Life Interrupted.

items.title: #97 What Kind Of Idiot Gets Phished?
items.author: Gimlet
items.description:
This week, Phia wonders what kind of person falls for phishing attacks. Is it only insanely gullible luddites, or can smart, tech savvy people get phished, too? To find out, she conducts an experiment on her poor, unsuspecting coworkers.

Follow Daniel Boteanu on twitter
